candidates.title: Update reedline to improved undo-system
candidates.body:
# Description

@bnprks fixed inadequacies of our previous undo system, now better coalescing of combinable events of user keypresses (typing, deleting, history navigation). Plus better interface for the outside world (e.g. implemented custom completion menus)

- Update after Reedline API update
- Update reedline

(Reedline bump also includes improvements to keybindings)

# Tests

candidates.title: Add repository info to all workspace crates
candidates.body:
This helps people who find these crates on crates.io

# Description

Currently on crates.io, crates like nu-glob look like they have no public repo. I found nu-glob while looking for a better-maintained glob crate, but then I had a devil of a time finding the nushell project :) I didn't know it existed so I didn't know where to look.

Adding the repository links to all sub crates means the repo is only one click away.

# Tests

Unfortunately this is not testable until the crates are published.

No code changes.

candidates.title: Bump chrono dependency to fix panic
candidates.body:
# Description

Bumping `chrono` to hopefully fix an issue reported on Discord:

> hi, since 0.66.3, i get this when trying to run nu on aarch64 (rpi 4) https://paste.debian.net/1250272/
thanks
ls /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/chrono-0.4.20/src/offset/local/unix.rs 
/root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/chrono-0.4.20/src/offset/local/unix.rs

I'm unable to reproduce that on my Raspberry Pi, but it is probably [this `chrono` issue](https://github.com/chronotope/chrono/issues/755#issuecomment-1209543845) which is fixed in [v0.4.21](https://github.com/chronotope/chrono/releases/tag/v0.4.21)

Update: user said they're on Void Linux, I'm on Debian 11. That's probably the real issue, not aarch64

# Tests

candidates.title: make `date format` supports locale
candidates.body:
# Description
The idea comes from discord message: https://discord.com/channels/601130461678272522/614593951969574961/1007130690472640632

> is it expected that nu seems to completely ignore locale settings? like even for things like date format '%c' which should be in the system locale

I think this is useful to myself, so I'm trying to implement it.

As title, fix `%x`, `%X`, `%c` behavior to make them works more friendly.

Quickly reference for %x, %X, %c:
```
╭───┬───────────────┬──────────────────────────┬─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│ # │ Specification │         Example          │                       Description                       │
├───┼───────────────┼──────────────────────────┼─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ 0 │ %x            │ 08/12/22                 │ Locale's date representation (e.g., 12/31/99).          │
│ 1 │ %X            │ 23:16:17                 │ Locale's time representation (e.g., 23:13:48).          │
│ 2 │ %c            │ Fri Aug 12 23:16:17 2022 │ Locale's date and time (e.g., Thu Mar 3 23:05:25 2005). │
╰───┴───────────────┴──────────────────────────┴─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
```

## Notes
~1. Actually I have no idea how to add tests to test for the behavior, because we can't make any assume about locale in CI machine.~ (It's resolved, thanks for the https://github.com/nushell/nushell/pull/6085)
~2. I'm failed to get a short flag for `--locale`, because `-l` is used.~

# Tests

Make sure you've done the following:

- [ ] Add tests that cover your changes, either in the command examples, the crate/tests folder, or in the /tests folder.
- [ ] Try to think about corner cases and various ways how your changes could break. Cover them with tests.
- [ ] If adding tests is not possible, please document in the PR body a minimal example with steps on how to reproduce so one can verify your change works.

Make sure you've run and fixed any issues with these commands:

- [X] `cargo fmt --all -- --check` to check standard code formatting (`cargo fmt --all` applies these changes)
- [X] `cargo clippy --workspace --features=extra -- -D warnings -D clippy::unwrap_used -A clippy::needless_collect` to check that you're using the standard code style
- [X] `cargo test --workspace --features=extra` to check that all the tests pass

candidates.title: Replace pretty_env_logger with simplelog
candidates.body:
# Description

This PR replaces `pretty_env_logger` with `simplelog`, with this change we can log to a file, which is helpful for debugging. `env_logger` has some issues on custom log target, and it seems that it will not fix soon. 

env-logger-rs/env_logger/issues/208

Fixes #5963

candidates.title: when spawned process during register plugin, pass env to child process
candidates.body:
# Description

while using python based plugin, I find myself get the following error:

![Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11 01 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22256154/183330275-e026aea5-ddd4-460c-a375-4e82a5f9059c.png)

After investigate, I found it's because when spawn child process, it doesn't take ENVs from current env, this may be not important for rust based plugin, but it's crucial for python(or maybe other languages which have virtual environments) based plugin.

This pr is going to fix the problem, so it matches the following comment in python plugin example:
https://github.com/nushell/nushell/blob/8b55757a0b82fa4fba81feaf70eb0f6e97aaab9c/crates/nu_plugin_python/plugin.py#L16-L17



# Tests

candidates.title: replace the regex crate with the fancy-regex crate
candidates.body:
# Description

This PR replaces the `regex` crate with the `fancy-regex` crate. This gives us more regex functionality without the limitations that the `regex` crate imposes. The great thing about the `fancy-regex` crate is that if you don't use the "fancy" features, it just falls back to using the `regex` crate. The error reporting seems to be better with `fancy-regex` too. Instead of having two error variants, `fancy-regex` has 21. So, this should be a win-win. This supersedes #6221.

I added a few more tests to the Examples in `parse` and `str replace`.

Read more about `fancy-regex` [here](https://docs.rs/fancy-regex/0.10.0/fancy_regex/).

# Tests

Make sure you've done the following:

- [x] Add tests that cover your changes, either in the command examples, the crate/tests folder, or in the /tests folder.
- [ ] Try to think about corner cases and various ways how your changes could break. Cover them with tests.
- [ ] If adding tests is not possible, please document in the PR body a minimal example with steps on how to reproduce so one can verify your change works.

Make sure you've run and fixed any issues with these commands:

- [x] `cargo fmt --all -- --check` to check standard code formatting (`cargo fmt --all` applies these changes)
- [x] `cargo clippy --workspace --features=extra -- -D warnings -D clippy::unwrap_used -A clippy::needless_collect` to check that you're using the standard code style
- [x] `cargo test --workspace --features=extra` to check that all the tests pass

candidates.title: Add decimals to int when using `into string --decimals`
candidates.body:
# Description

This is a follow up to PR https://github.com/nushell/nushell/pull/6084. It was intended as a fix to https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/6078 but @merelymyself beat me to it.

However, this PR adds the decimal digits in a way that they get also added when `group_digits` is set to `true` (see: https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/6078#issuecomment-1189636421).

I also added tests for `into string` when converting int with `--decimals`.

chosen_pr.title: Bump chrono dependency to fix panic
chosen_pr.body:
# Description

Bumping `chrono` to hopefully fix an issue reported on Discord:

> hi, since 0.66.3, i get this when trying to run nu on aarch64 (rpi 4) https://paste.debian.net/1250272/
thanks
ls /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/chrono-0.4.20/src/offset/local/unix.rs 
/root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/chrono-0.4.20/src/offset/local/unix.rs

I'm unable to reproduce that on my Raspberry Pi, but it is probably [this `chrono` issue](https://github.com/chronotope/chrono/issues/755#issuecomment-1209543845) which is fixed in [v0.4.21](https://github.com/chronotope/chrono/releases/tag/v0.4.21)

Update: user said they're on Void Linux, I'm on Debian 11. That's probably the real issue, not aarch64
